English (United States)(en-US): Amidst the rustling of leaves, I listened to her lengthy tale.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 바람이 불어 잎새가 흔들리는 소리와 함께 나무의 긴 이야기를 들었어.

English (United States)(en-US): The tree had stood there for as long as she could remember.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나무는 기억나지 않을 정도로 오래 전부터 그 자리에 있었대.

English (United States)(en-US): She saw everything around her wither, fade, turn to ash,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 자신을 제외한 주위의 모든 것들이 시들고 저물며, 재가 되고,

English (United States)(en-US): yet bloom again many times over.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 끝내 다시 싹을 틔우는 것을 몇 번이고 보면서.

English (United States)(en-US): ‘All minute things destined to disappear are meaningless.’
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ‘언젠가 사라지는 한 줌의 것들은 모두 무의미하다’고 생각했어.

English (United States)(en-US): Then one day, the tree met a small human with sparkling eyes.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그러던 어느 날, 나무는 눈빛이 반짝이는 작은 인간을 만났어.

English (United States)(en-US): The human visited the tree every day.
She was as tall as the tree’s stump. Then she grew, and her eyes became wiser.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나무 밑동과 키가 비슷하던 인간 아이는 점점 자랐고, 어느덧 눈빛이 깊어졌어.

English (United States)(en-US): She then grew smaller and her hair whiter.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그러다 다시 조금씩 작아졌고 머리가 하얗게 새기 시작했지.

English (United States)(en-US): On the last day they saw each other, the human caressed her trunk and said "Thank you."
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나무가 인간을 마지막으로 보던 날, 인간은 나무의 몸을 매만지며 ‘고마웠어’라고 말했대.

English (United States)(en-US): The tree realized she had come to love the human who would soon disappear.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나무는 어느새 자신이 곧 사라져 버릴 인간을 사랑하고 있었다는 것을 깨달았어.

English (United States)(en-US): And the tree resigned once more to a long life without the human.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그리고 나무는 다시 인간이 없는 긴 시간을 살아 내기 시작했어.

English (United States)(en-US): But thinking she was amid all the seasons the human had lived through,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 참 이상하게도… 그 인간이 지나왔던 계절들,

English (United States)(en-US): amid those beloved flowers and skies, the tree didn't feel lonely anymore.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 인간이 사랑했던 꽃과 하늘의 한가운데에 있다고 생각하니 전처럼 외롭지 않았대.

English (United States)(en-US): Once you give meaning to what seems meaningless, it becomes invaluable.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 무의미해 보이는 것에 의미를 부여하는 순간, 무엇보다 가치 있어진다는 것을.
